# pause()

**Instance Method**

Stops sending distance and direction updates to the peer.

## Declaration

```swift
func pause()
```

## Discussion

To resume a paused session, the app calls [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISession/run(_:)], passing in the session’s configuration.

If an app pauses the session for too long, the peer receives [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NISessionDelegate/session(_:didRemove:reason:)] callback with the [doc://com.apple.nearbyinteraction/documentation/NearbyInteraction/NINearbyObject/RemovalReason/timeout] reason.

## Managing life cycle

- **delegate**: An object that the framework notifies of session events.
- **invalidate()**: Stops a running session.
